intro: Dyschoriste trichocalyx, commonly known as the hairy dyschoris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a rough texture. Dyschoriste trichocalyx is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
